transcripts.prompt: Please transcribe the text from the following image with high accuracy. Ensure that all punctuation, capitalization, and formatting are preserved as closely as possible to the original. If any part of the text is illegible or unclear, indicate this with '[illegible]' in the transcription. Pay special attention to names, dates, and any specific terminology. Please provide only the transcription. Do not say anything like 'Here is the transcription of the image'
transcripts.extracted_text: State of New York Montgomery SS  Margaret Timmerman being duly sworn deposeth & saith that she is aged Sixty three years that she was acquainted with Henry Hawn and Nancy Hawn at the time they were married that she was Present at the Wedding and that she was also Married at the same time to my brother Hawn in Minden in said county and that Dominie Peck performed the Marriage ceremony, on the fifteenth day of February 1789 and that she believes that the said Henry Hawn and Nancy his wife Lived together for some time in the same house where she this deponent did in said Town of Minden further saith not  Sworn & Subscribed before me     Margaret X Timmerman this 4th day of September 1838                mark John W Harcen Justice of the Peace  I John W Harcen a Justice of the Peace of the Town of Minden in the County of Montgomery before whom the above affidavit was taken do hereby certify that I am well acquainted with Margaret Timmerman and do know her to be a person of good character for truth and veracity, and her statement entitled to credit and that she was not taught to write and did make her mark before me Sept 4th 1838  John. W. Harcen Justice  State of New York Montgomery County  Clerks Office SS I certify that John W Harcen Esqr whose name is subscribed to the jurat & c of the foregoing affidavit or proceeding was on the day of its date therein a Justice of the Peace in & for the County of Montgomery duly elected and qualified and that the signature to the same is his Genuine Signature  My hand and official Seal at Fonda this eleventh day of September, in the year 1838  A Brown Clerk
transcripts.original_text: State of New York Montgomery Margaret Timmerman being duly sworn deposth and saith that she is aged sixty seven years that she was acquainted with Henry House and Nancy House at the time they were married that she was present at the wedding and that she was also married at the same time at my fathers house in >>> in said county ceremony on the fifteenth day of February 1789 and that she knows that the said Henry House and Nancy his wife lives together for some time in the same town where she this deponent did in said town of >>> further south >>> Sworn and >>> before me this 4th day of September 1838 John Haven, Justice of the Peace Margaret Timmerman X her mark I John Haven a Justice of the Peace of the town of >>> in the county of Montgomery before whom the >>> of >>> was taken to hereby certify that I am well acquainted with Margaret Timmerman and do know her to be a person of good character for truth and veracity and her statement entitled to credit and that she was not taught to write and did mark her mark all before me September 4th, 1838. John Hawn, Justice State of New York Montgomery County Clerks Office I certify that John W. Hawn esq. whole name is subscribed to the Justice of the forgoing affidavit and proceedings was on the day of the date >>> a Justice of the Peace >>> and for the County of Montgomery duly elected and >>> and that the signature to the same is his genuine signature.

transcripts.extracted_text: State of New York Montgomery County  §  Margaret Zimmerman being duly sworn deposith & saith that she is a credible witness, that she was acquainted with Henry Hoven and Nancy Hause at the time they were married that she was Present at the Wedding and that she was also married at the same time at my father's House in Minden in Said County and that Domine Reah performed the marriage Ceremony on the fifteenth day of February 1789 and that she knows that the said Henry Hoven and Nancy his wife lived together for some time in the same Town where the said deponent did in said Town of Minden further saith not Sworn and Subscribed before me                                        her this 4th day of September 1838                   Margaret  X  Zimmerman                                                                            mark John W. Faron Justice of the Peace  §  I John W. Faron a justice of the Peace of the Town of Minden in the County of Montgomery before whom the above affidavit was taken do hereby certify that I am well acquainted with Margaret Zimmerman and do know her to be a person of good character for truth and veracity and her statement entitled to credit and that she was not taught to write and did make her mark all before me Sept 4th 1838                                                        John. W. Faron. Justice  State of New York Montgomery County  Clerk's Office ss I Certify that John W. Faron Esqr whose name is subscribed to the jurate of the foregoing affidavit, & proceeding was on the day of the date thereof a Justice of the Peace in and for the County of Montgomery, duly elected and Qualified, and that the signature to the same is his genuine signature  In Testimony whereof I have hereunto set my hand and affixed my official Seal this Eleventh day of September in the year 1838.                                          J. F. Lowine, Clerk
